body: Just noticed this was already reported in #6023.

issue.title: Documentation website on mobile fails on transitions.
issue.body:
The docs page fails to transition on mobile:
1. Enter https://reacttraining.com/react-router/core/
2. Pick any topic
3. Nothing changes

In console

```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '_debugID' of undefined
    at Object.setValueForStyles (CSSPropertyOperations.js:225)
    at Object.i [as current] (react-dom.js:37)
    at e.r [as _callback] (createAnimatedComponent.js:52)
    at e.update (AnimatedProps.js:76)
    at AnimatedValue.js:58
...
```

The error comes from the [`react-css-property-operations`](https://github.com/meyer-archives/react-css-property-operations) library, which was extracted from `react-dom` and is in an archived state.

Code that calls the failing method.
https://github.com/ReactTraining/react-router/blob/02e6da9a791ac90fac5838e7e4943233af7bf118/website/modules/animated/targets/react-dom.js#L33-L45

body:
@mjackson I think after moving to react 16

[this line](https://github.com/ReactTraining/react-router/blob/master/website/modules/animated/targets/react-dom.js#L40):  
` comp._reactInternalInstance`

Should be:
`comp._reactInternalFiber`

Not sure though :thinking:

@mjackson  After playing around, the change i proposed above :arrow_up:  did help, however there is another error, now within `react-css-property-operations/lib/CSSPropertyOperations.js`.
There is no `_currentElement` property in `component` (again i think it's a conflict with the new react 16).
There is however a `_debugOwner` property.

![fiberowner](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9153149/38275248-f6481c58-3799-11e8-8302-a1b15ae33089.jpg)

I'm not sure what was the reason for using `react-css-property-operations` but it seems that it is [abandoned](https://github.com/meyer-archives/react-css-property-operations) and probably is not supporting react v16.

<hr/>

**As a side note**, I had a lot of errors while trying to run the website locally. seems like most of the paths to the modules in `react-router-dom` are off. 
They are targeting to the root of `react-router-dom` instead to `react-router-dom/modules`

Just to name a few: [ReactRouterDOMShim](https://github.com/ReactTraining/react-router/blob/master/website/modules/ReactRouterDOMShim.js#L16), [generatePath](https://github.com/ReactTraining/react-router/blob/master/packages/react-router-dom/modules/generatePath.js#L2), [MemoryRouter](https://github.com/ReactTraining/react-router/blob/master/packages/react-router-dom/modules/MemoryRouter.js#L2) and the list goes on...

I guess this should be on a different issue then.

Hope I helped :wink:

@sag1v you have to run `npm run build` in the root so that the monorepo packages get built. I updated the `CONTRIBUTING.md` file earlier to reflect this, but as I mentioned in #6061, we should probably auto-build after install so that new contributors don't have to go looking for build instructions.

I created an un-minified webpack build to try and figure out what is going on here (see attached) üïµÔ∏è It looks like our bundle includes a `process` shim which is preventing `process.env.NODE_ENV` from being evaluated properly at build time, so the debugging code with the `_debugID` isn't being stripped out. However, it also looks like we have a **bundle within our bundle**, probably because the Animated code isn't an actual dependency (it's just copied over from an older version of the library) üôÉ For example, you can see here that entry # 463 in the outer bundle actually exports a webpack bundle of the Animated library: So I'm guessing we need to either a) fix that inner bundle and get the `process` shim out of it so the webpack `DefinePlugin` can do its job and replace all the `process.env.NODE_ENV` references or b) figure out which commit (`git bisect`, anyone?) caused this weird behavior and undo the regression. I've uploaded my build here in case anyone would like to go poking around üëá [build.zip](https://github.com/ReactTraining/react-router/files/1943678/build.zip)

issue.title: Webpage's responsive route does not work
issue.body:
## Version
https://reacttraining.com/react-router/core/guides/philosophy

## Test Case
When browsing the web page using a mobile device or test in 'toggle device model'  of Chrome, the back arrow does not work, and it will make the page hanging which is a quite bad example of responsive routing.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10129395/43934120-c3f8924c-9ca1-11e8-9ee4-868b77e6ba31.png)

## Steps to reproduce
1 Open https://reacttraining.com/react-router/core/guides/philosophy from a mobile device or use Chrome to stimulate a mobile device,  you could see the resolution I use in Chrome from snapshot I upload in Test Case.

2 Try to click the button I tag with a red rectangle.
## Expected Behavior
Go back to Menu
## Actual Behavior
No action.

issue.title: Update Animated library to latest version (supports React 16) (fixes #6058)
issue.body:
Hello there! This is my first pull request to your repository. It updates the Animated component library in the website directory to the newest version (as seen here: https://github.com/animatedjs/animated), in order to fix an error on the mobile browser. 

The Animated library was using some undocumented internals of React that appear to have been changed in the new version, causing weird exceptions deep in the Animated code. I would recommend testing this solution as I was unable to find any test files for the website, and I also had to make some local modifications to get the app running on my Windows machine (not committed!).

Thanks,
tdurtschi
